intro: Tovomita choisyana, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a tropical shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a fleshy, star-shaped berry that turns red when ripe, containing numerous seeds. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
